creator: march@asg.com
text:
The <import file="somefile> task ignores the basedir value set at the command 
line.

given 
/test/a/build.xml
/test/a/copystuff.xml
/test/b/copystuff.xml

and the line 
<import file="copystuff.xml"/>
in build.xml
the file /test/a/copystuff.xml will always be imported despite a command line 
like:
ant -Dbasedir=/test/b

I have only tried this in Windows XP

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
This is by design, from the ant manual:
"file: The file to import. If this is a relative file name, the file name will
be resolved relative to the importing file. Note, this is unlike most other ant
file attributes, where relative files are resolved relative to ${basedir}."

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
Note that if you want basedir relative resolution, just go

<import file="${basedir}/file.xml">
